fields.code_html: This is a headline
fields.title: Headlines

fields.code_html:
• This is a bulleted list.
  • It has two items, the second item uses two lines.
fields.code:
* This is a bulleted list.
* It has two items, the second
  item uses two lines.
fields.title: Bullet Lists

fields.code_html:
• this is
  • a list
    • with a nested list
    • and some subitems
  • and here the parent list continues
fields.code:
* this is
* a list

  * with a nested list
  * and some subitems

* and here the parent list continues
fields.title: Bullet Lists

fields.code_html:
1. This is a numbered list.
  2. It has two items too.
fields.code:
1. This is a numbered list.
2. It has two items too.
fields.title: Numbered Lists

fields.code_html:
1. This is a numbered list.
  2. It has two items too.
fields.code:
#. This is a numbered list.
#. It has two items too.
fields.title: Numbered Lists

fields.code_html:
term (up to a line of text)
Definition of the term, which must be indented
next term
Description.
fields.code:
term (up to a line of text)
   Definition of the term, which must be indented

next term
   Description.
fields.title: Definition Lists

fields.code_html:
Ordinary text …

Quoted paragraphs are created by just indenting them more than the surrounding paragraphs.

Ordinary text …
fields.code:
Ordinary text …

    Quoted paragraphs are created by just indenting 
    them more than the surrounding paragraphs.

Ordinary text …
fields.title: Quotes

fields.code_html:
Header row, column 1 (header rows optional) Header 2 Header 3
body row 1, column 1 column 2 column 3
body row 2 ... ...
fields.title: Tables

fields.code_html: You may highlight a specific element in the viewer.
fields.code:
You may highlight a :highlight:`specific element <rhemi>`
in the viewer.
fields.title: Highlights

fields.code_html: Some term in the text may need a description.
fields.code: Some :glossary:`term` in the text may need a description.
fields.title: Glossary

fields.code_html: Sometimes the term in the text is different from the one in the glossary.
fields.code:
Sometimes the :glossary:`term in the text <term>` 
is different from the one in the glossary.
fields.title: Glossary

fields.code_html: Sources should be referenced like this (Name, 2011)
fields.code: Sources should be referenced like this (:source:`Name, 2011`)
fields.title: Sources

fields.code_html: Sometimes there is a compressed notation of two references like this: Name, 2011; 2012.
fields.code: Sometimes there is a compressed notation of two references like this: :source:`Name, 2011`; :source:`2012 <Name, 2012>`.
fields.title: Sources

fields.code_html: You can create links that activate a specific scene in the viewer.
fields.code: You can create links that :scene:`activate a specific scene <page4>` in the viewer.
fields.title: Scenes
